#Text=Scotland says ' No ' in independence referendum
#Text=Friday , September 19 , 2014
#Text=Polling day
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Residents of Scotland voted against becoming an independent nation yesterday in the Scottish independence referendum .
#Text=The country is to remain part of the United Kingdom .
#Text=In a turnout of 84.6 % of some 4.3 million eligible voters , 55 % voted against and 45 % voted for the proposition " Should Scotland be an independent country ? " .
#Text=File photo of Alistair Darling in 2006 .
#Text=Image : Antonio Cruz/ABr .

#Text=Polling stations opened at 7.00 a. m on the 18th with queues outside some of the 5,579 stations , and many were busy until the polls closed at 22.00 p.m. Overnight , after the first result was announced at 1:30 a. m. , the " No " vote slowly edged ahead .

column1: #Text=Just after 6:00 a. m. , with the declaration of the results for Fife , the " No " campaign attained an unassailable lead .

column1: #Text=With the final declaration by the Highland Council this gave a final total of 1,617,989 " Yes " and 2,001,926 " No " votes .
#Text=When the referendum was announced in March of 2013
#Text=Australia 's ABC reported that opinion polls showed only 30 % of the Scottish population supported independence , with 50 % favouring the preservation of the Union .
#Text=On the eve of the referendum this had narrowed to " No " 45 % , " Yes " 41 % with 14 % remaining undecided .
#Text=With a greater margin than recent polls had suggested the majority of these undecided voters ultimately voted " No " to win it for the pro-union camp .

#Text=Celebrating the continuation of the Union , Alistair Darling , leader of the pro-union Better Together campaign , addressing " No " campaign workers said " You represent the majority of opinion and your voices have been heard .

#Text=We have taken on the argument and we have won , the silent have spoken .

_	_	_	_

#Text=concluding  Come on Scotland , let 's get on with it together . "

column1: #Text=File photo of Alex Salmond in 2008 .
#Text=Image : Scottish Government .

#Text=Following the defeat , a defiant Alex Salmond , leader of the pro-independence Scottish National Party , said " Thank you to Scotland for 1.6 million votes for Scottish independence " and " Scotland by majority has decided not at this stage to become an independent country " .
#Text=Salmond concluded : " Let us not dwell on the distance we have fallen short , but on the distance we have come . "
#Text=David Cameron , Prime Minister of the United Kingdom , said " The people of Scotland have spoken and it is a clear result .

#Text=They have kept our country of four nations together and like millions of other people I am delighted .

_	_	_	_

#Text=On the package of greater devolved powers for Scotland promised late in the day to the Scottish people , Cameron said :  We will ensure that those commitments are honoured in full . "

column1: #Text=and that " We have delivered on devolution and we will do so in the next parliament . "

#Text=Promising that in delivering the " vow " a parallel process will address the West Lothian question and work towards greater devolution of powers to Wales , Northern Ireland , and at Westminster , English only votes on English issues .

#Text=David Cameron must now negotiate with the Westminster parties and convince them — especially some within his own party — to pass legislation through Westminster to enable this before the March 2015 date promised .
